SEARCH
Package model

Class Player

java.lang.Object
model.Player
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Player extends Object implements Serializable
The Player class represents a player in the game. It implements the Serializable interface to support serialization and deserialization.
See Also:

    • Player

      public Player(int id, String name)
      Constructs a new Player object with the provided ID and name.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier of the player.
      name - the name of the player.

  • Method Details

    • setLastRound

      public void setLastRound(boolean lastRound)
      Sets the flag indicating whether it is the last round of a game.
      Parameters:
      lastRound - true if it is the last round, false otherwise.

    • setName

      public void setName(String name)
      Sets the name of an object.
      Parameters:
      name - the new name to be set.

    • isLastRound

      public boolean isLastRound()
      Checks whether it is the last round of a game.
      Returns:
      true if it is the last round, false otherwise.

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Retrieves the name of the player.
      Returns:
      the name of the player.

    • getId

      public int getId()
      Retrieves the ID of the player.
      Returns:
      the ID of the player.

    • getShelf

    • getPersonalGoal

      public PersonalGoal getPersonalGoal()
      Retrieves the personal goal of the player.
      Returns:
      the personal goal of the player.

    • getPoints

      public int getPoints()
      Retrieves the points earned by the player.
      Returns:
      the points earned by the player.

    • getPGpoints

      public int getPGpoints()
      Retrieves the personal goal points earned by the player.
      Returns:
      the personal goal points earned by the player.

    • setPointsEndGame

      public void setPointsEndGame()
      Increases the points earned by the player at the end of the game. This method is called to increment the player's points by one.

    • convertPoints

      public void convertPoints(Tile[][] matrix)
      Converts the points for the player based on the given matrix of tiles. The method calculates the points by finding groups of tiles of the same color and assigning points based on the group size. The calculated points are added to the player's existing points.
      Parameters:
      matrix - the matrix of tiles representing the game board.

    • setPoints

      public void setPoints(int points)
      Sets the points earned by the player.
      Parameters:
      points - the points to be set and added to the player's existing points.

    • setCGPoints

      public void setCGPoints(int points)
      Sets the common goal points earned by the player.
      Parameters:
      points - the common goal points to be set for the player.

    • setCommonGoalsCompleted

      public void setCommonGoalsCompleted(int indexCompleted)
      Sets the completion status of a common goal for the player.
      Parameters:
      indexCompleted - the index of the common goal to mark as completed.

    • getCommonGoalsCompleted

      public boolean[] getCommonGoalsCompleted()
      Retrieves the completion status of the common goals for the player.
      Returns:
      an array representing the completion status of the common goals.

    • isShelfCompleted

      public boolean isShelfCompleted()
      Checks if the player's shelf is completed and returns the completion status. If the shelf is completed, it updates the completion status accordingly.
      Returns:
      true if the player's shelf is completed, false otherwise.

    • setShelfCompleted

      public void setShelfCompleted(boolean stato)
      Sets the completion status of the player's shelf.
      Parameters:
      stato - the completion status of the player's shelf.

    • getShelfCompleted

      public boolean getShelfCompleted()
      Retrieves the completion status of the player's shelf.
      Returns:
      true if the player's shelf is completed, false otherwise.

    • checkPersonalGoal

      public void checkPersonalGoal()
      Checks if the player's shelf satisfies their personal goal and updates the personal goal points accordingly. The player's shelf layout is compared with the personal goal layout to count the matching tiles and determine the points.

    • sumUpPoints

      public void sumUpPoints()
      Sum up the player's points by adding the personal goal points to the total points.

    • getShelfMatrix

      public Tile[][] getShelfMatrix()
      Updates the player's total points by adding the personal goal points. The personal goal points are added to the existing total points.

    • removeCGPoints

      public void removeCGPoints()
      Removes the common goal points from the player's total points. The common goal points are subtracted from the existing total points.

    • getCGpoints

      public int getCGpoints()
      Retrieves the common goal points earned by the player.
      Returns:
      the common goal points earned by the player.
